results.title: Water service
results.creator_credit: Selwyn Films, C A Radley and David MacKane
results.brief_description: How water is carried from lakes and streams to the reservoirs where it is put through filter beds to be purified, before being piped from power-houses to the consumers. Samples of water are continually being tested for contamination and impurities.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Selwyn Films, C A Radley and David MacKane

results.title: Water says
results.brief_description: Clouds of early morning mist roll back revealing dew laden plants. A stream ripples down the mountain, bubbling around stones and cascading down the slope. It widens and flows gently on until it reaches the unpredictable sea. Accompanied by water sounds and appropriate background music. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Water safety: an introduction
results.creator_credit: Michael Delean and Associates and Michael Delean
results.brief_description: Water accidents can be prevented if you know which situations spell danger. But if you find yourself or someone else in trouble in the water, there are specific techniques which can save lives or buy time until help arrives. Here are illustrated a variety of ways to avoid water accidents, the right and wrong ways of helping yourself or someone else in trouble, and survival floating techniques.

results.title: Water safety
results.creator_credit: Town and Country Productions and Bill Latto
results.brief_description: An appreciation of the factors affecting the safety of those people who enjoy recreation both in and on the water. Shows a senior service safety patrol boat in action. The lifeguard carries out mouth-to-mouth resucitation; a swimming instructor teaches life saving methods. Considers the care and maintenance of craft, rescue techniques, and wearing of life jackets when boating.

results.title: Water project
results.creator_credit: Australian Wool Corporation and Frank Land
results.brief_description: Describes methods for irrigation of lands which receive an irregular rainfall. At the Sydney University Animal Husbandry Farm experiments were carried out on dry pastures and it was found that irrigation dams, supplied by run-off from the farm, made available a plentiful year-round supply of water. Portable sprinkler systems were used to distribute the dam water. Another irrigation system is the Keyline System, the main feature of which is the off-contour ribbing of land so that water is collected where it falls and used when required. Dams along the ribs provide storage for excess water.

results.title: Water power
results.creator_credit: Gateway Film Productions, Graham Smart and Robin Ridgway
results.brief_description:
Shows ways in which water wheels operate and generate electricity. Other ways of making use of water power are examined. The film takes an historical approach.
Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Water power
results.creator_credit: ERPI Classroom Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: A study of the development of the use of water power in the USA, from the small watermill of the early settler to the immense hydro-electricity projects at Niagara, Boulder Dam, and the Tennessee Valley today. A survey of the potential water-power of the world completes the film.

results.title: Water polo: training practices
results.brief_description: Illustrates how the basic skills of water polo can best be practised. The practices are grouped as 1. ball handling practices, 2. films training practices, and 3. tactical practices. Great Britain Water Polo Squad demonstrates the skill. Suitable for players, teachers and coaches.
